intro: Actinophloeus propinquus, commonly known as the slender wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, woody stems with small, compound leaves and produces yellow flowers in spikes. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
